title: API Docs: sync

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: E-medium
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Medium / intermediate

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/


Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [ ] [the module-level documentation](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/) is very small. It should explain what the module is for in more detail, with some examples.
- [x] [`std::sync::atomic`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/atomic/) could use links to the types it references.
- [x] [`std::sync::atomic::fence`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/atomic/fn.fence.html) has very... dry docs that aren't very helpful. And there's no examples.
- [x] [`ATOMIC_*_INIT`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/atomic/constant.ATOMIC_BOOL_INIT.html)  (link is just to BOOL but all of them) could use examples.
- [ ] [`Atomic*`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/atomic/struct.AtomicBool.html) (link is to Bool but all of them) are mostly fine, but could use links to other types and some beefing up generally.
- [x] [`Barrier`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.Barrier.html) needs a bunch of types linked.
- [x] [`BarrierWaitResult`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.BarrierWaitResult.html) should explain its relationship with `Barrier` and link to it.
- [x] [`Condvar`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.Condvar.html) needs examples on its methods.
- [x] [`Once`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.Once.html) needs to link to `ONCE_INIT`.
- [x] [`PoisonError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.PoisonError.html) needs examples.
- [x] [`RwLock`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.RwLock.html) needs examples, links to types, and a comparison between it and `Mutex`.
- [x] [`WaitTimeoutResult`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.WaitTimeoutResult.html) should link to the method that creates it.
- [x] [`TryLockError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/enum.TryLockError.html) needs to link to the function that creates it.
- [x] [`ONCE_INIT`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/constant.ONCE_INIT.html) needs a link to `Once` and some examples.
- [x] [`LockResult`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/type.LockResult.html) needs links.
- [x] [`TryLockResult`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/type.TryLockResult.html) needs links.
- [x] [`Weak`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/struct.Weak.html) could do a much better job of explaining itself.
- [x] [`std::sync::mspc`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/) needs a lot of links. The docs are good but a bit jargon-heavy, expanding those would be nice.
- [x] [`IntoIter`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.IntoIter.html) needs more links and to explain how you get one.
- [x] [`Iter`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.Iter.html) is the same.
- [x] [`Receiver`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.Receiver.html) needs links, examples, and more explanation of what it is.
- [x] [`RecvError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.RecvError.html) needs to link to `recv`.
- [x] [`SendError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.SendError.html) needs links.
- [x] [`Sender`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.Sender.html) has the same issues as `Receiver`.
- [x] [`SyncSender`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.SyncSender.html) has the same as `Sender`.
- [x] [`TryIter`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/struct.TryIter.html) needs to link to how to create one.
- [x] [`RecvTimeoutError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/enum.RecvTimeoutError.html) needs to link to `recv_timeout`.
- [x] [`TryRecvError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/enum.TryRecvError.html) needs to link to `try_recv`
- [x] [`TrySendError`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/enum.TrySendError.html) needs to link to `try_send`.
- [x] [`channel`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/fn.channel.html) has almost no docs and it's the focus of this module!
- [x] [`sync_channel`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/sync/mpsc/fn.sync_channel.html) should point to `channel` and then tell how it's different.
